subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New to Group
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1206460688
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Pat,
 
I have a technician named Brian.  And as far as I have seen nobody  else has 
mentioned the name "Brian"
as a technicians name.  He has been very helpful to me especially on  my 
initial starting up on this research.
I once asked him his age and if I remember correctly he said 19-1/2 years  
old.  But over there age is just a number and the spirits can be any number  
they desire.  I will look into this further for you and see .
 
Jeff
 
In a message dated 3/25/2008 10:36:21 A.M. Central Daylight Time,  
patfromct1954@... writes:

 
 
 
Hi all, I just wanted to introduce myself. As you can see from my 
addy,  my name is Pat and from CT (and sometimes Maine) ...

My youngest son  committed suicide 10 yrs ago. He was one of many 
young men in my family to  pass on young (he was 24, I was 43) and our 
birthdays were only a week  apart. His birthday would have been 
Easter Sunday.

I was introduced  to Frank's Box via Paranormal State and it spiked my 
interest. I do have  an avid interest with the paranormal, howevere, 
I do believe that if I  ever had anything happen to me personally, I 
would probably  panic.

I am interested in the price of someone making a box for me,  and, of 
course, instructions on how to do this and stay safe. Like many  
others, my interest is contact with family members who have passed 
on,  most especially, my son Brian. He was a believer in these things 
too.  Unfortunately, he was diagnosed with a mental illness, and 
instead of  giving meds a try, he felt his life would never 
be "normal" again, and  chose to go back home to God and his 
beloved "Gramps". I cry just thinking  of all this, as my father was 
most Beloved to me too.

If any of you  are able to ask the question if Brian or Tom (grandson 
and grandfather)  are present, and if they can get any messages to me, 
I would appreciate  it. The tears are streaming down my eyes just 
thinking of all this, as I  lost Brian and my Dad within about 18 mos 
of each other.

Have to  run, I hear my sis coming home. Thanks for any help any of 
you could  offer.
Pat


 




**************Create a Home Theater Like the Pros. Watch the video on AOL 
Home.      
(http://home.aol.com/diy/home-improvement-eric-stromer?video=15?ncid=aolhom00030000000001)
